title: Bash Trap Command
description: In Bash scripting, the trap command allows you to catch and handle signals, interruptions, and user inputs in your script. By using trap, you can define specific actions to be taken when a particular signal is received, allowing you to prevent unpredictable behavior and gracefully handle various scenarios.

meta.title: Mastering Bash Trap Command: Gracefully Handle Signals and Interruptions
meta.description: Discover the power of the Bash trap command to catch and manage signals, interruptions, and user inputs in your scripts for reliable and predictable behavior.
